snippet: Two Democratic candidates struggle to court the city’s powerful labor unions and show independence from them at the same time.
abstract: Wendy Greuel and Eric Garceth, Democratic candidates for mayor in Los Angeles, have little separating them ideologically, but with years of experience at City Hall have both chided and courted labor unions; both face challenge of fighting over powerful force in city politics while trying to convince weary voters that they will be independent enough to force unions to accept cutbacks needed to solve looming budget problems.
lead_paragraph: Two Democratic candidates struggle to court the city’s powerful labor unions and show independence from them at the same time.

headline.seo: Unions Loom Large in Los Angeles Mayor’s Race
headline.main: Union Views Loom Large as Los Angeles Picks a Mayor
headline.print_headline: Union Views Loom Large As Los Angeles Picks a Mayor
